entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 2:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG NORTH WINDS AND SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE OVER BERING SEA... Behind a departing low pressure system, strong northerly winds will continue into the work week through the Bering Strait and into the northern Bering Sea. Sustained winds of 25 to 30 mph and gusts to 35 mph in conjunction with on and off snow showers could lead to reduced visibiltiy to one half mile at times. Strong winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref; St Lawrence Island

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 1:46PM AKST until December 09 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW CONTINUES INTO SATURDAY EVENING... The highest accumulations have fallen in the area from the back of the Mendenhall Valley and North of the Ferry Terminal, and at higher elevations. Snow ratios have decreased through this morning and accumulations have slowed down during the day time. Snow will tapper off Saturday evening.
